officialTitle: Pilot Adaptive Tool To Encourage Risk Reduction in iNfancy (PATTERN)

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Non-Hispanic black (as documented in MaestroCare) parents/caregivers with; infants ages 2 weeks to 2 months of age; infant birthweight between 2500g and 4000g; infant gestational age is at least 36 weeks

Exclusion Criteria:

* non-English-speaking; infant with serious disease or disorder affecting growth and nutrition

primary.measure: Number of Participants Satisfied or Very Satisfied With Information Given to Them, as Measured by Follow up Questionnaire
primary.description: Completed Likert scale with 1=very unsatisfied, 2=unsatisfied, 3=neutral, 4=satisfied, 5=very satisfied

primary.measure: Percentage of Successful Contacts With Families Via Telephone and/or in Clinic
primary.description: Number of successful contacts with families divided by number of attempts to contact by research staff x 100

secondary.measure: Percent of Participants Exclusively Breastfeeding at 4 Months Postnatal Age
secondary.description: Dyad caregivers were asked what type of milk was being consumed by the infant, with 4 options available: 1) Formula only, 2) Mostly formula and some breast milk, 3) Mostly breast milk, but some formula, or 4) Breast milk only.

secondary.measure: Percent of Participants Delaying Complementary Feeding Until 4 Months Postnatal Age
secondary.description: Dyads caregivers were asked, "Is your baby eating solid foods yet or do you put any solid foods in the bottle?", with 2 options available: 1) Yes or 2) No

secondary.measure: Percent of Participants Reporting "Never" Engaging in Screentime While Feeding and With '0' Minutes of Active TV Watching at 4 Months Postnatal Age
secondary.description: Dyad caregivers were asked "I watch TV or look at or use my phone while feeding my baby" and responded with one of 5 Likert-scale responses: 1) Never, 2) Seldom, 3) Half of the time, 4) Most of the time, 5) Always
